sub_title: Executive Vice President | Chief Technology, Innovation & Portfolio Officer | Non-Exec Board Director | Keynote Speaker | Active at intersection of Innovation & Humanity | European Women on Boards | Women in Tech®
summary:
**Follow me for tech, innovation, and sustainability news, digital healthcare and humanitarian insights, equity & inclusion advice, and empowerment leadership posts!**

Deep corporate background and Boardroom experience in digital & cultural transformation, technology, sustainability (ESG/CSR), digital healthcare, MedTech, business models, platform thinking, operational excellence, continuous process improvement, customer success, digital marketing, customer & patient journey, product & user experience, access & accessibility.

*****

Cara Antoine is an empowering global leader & keynote speaker who enables people and organisations to achieve more in the digital era. Her 29-year career is fueled by a purpose-led mission to positively impact society and the economy for the betterment of people and a more sustainable planet at the intersection of technology & humanity.

As EVP, Chief Technology & Portfolio Innovation Officer at Capgemini, Cara strategically advises global corporates at the CSuite across industries on digital & cultural transformation and sustainability, where she is an energetic and thought-provoking catalyst for enduring growth and change.

Prior to her role, Cara was Managing Director at IG&H, Chief Marketing & Operations Officer at Microsoft Netherlands and Vice President for Continuous Improvement and Digitalisation at Royal Shell. She has seasoned international experience in B2B & B2C operations at Hewlett-Packard, Compaq, and Polaroid.

Outside of work, Cara is changing the game in empowering women in science & tech. She serves as President & Non-Exec Board Member of Global Women in Tech for the Netherlands Chapter, as Country Chair for Digital Literacy at the G100, and as Supervisory Board Member at the Wortell Group, with the ambition to stimulate, empower, and upskill future generations of female leaders in tech.

As a Patient Leader, Cara’s focus on digital health and visual improvements led her to join the Board of the Cornea Patient Association and serve as Chairwoman of the Hennie Völker Dieben Award, at the Board of Easee, the first clinically proven CE & FDA-certified online eye-exam, and the Digital Health Committee of the European Society for Cataract and Refractive Surgeons (ESCRS).

Cara received Global Women in Tech’s 2022 “Global Excellence Award” and was named Computable's 2021 “Top 100 Most Influential Women in Business” and “Digital Leader of the Year”, DeMarketing’s 2020 “Top 100 Influencer in Media and Marketing”, and Global Digital Women’s 2019 “Global Digital Female Leader” in Digital Transformation.

profile_positions.title: Executive Vice President and Chief Technology, Innovation & Portfolio Officer

profile_positions.description:
I stand alongside powerhouse women, scale my influence, expand my capacity to lead, and I co-create meaningful, positive change for the future. I am a FutureMaker.

FutureWomenX is a global tribe of courageous, ambitious, forward-thinking female leaders united in a mission to elevate women and drive transformative change for a better future. We are senior executives, trailblazing entrepreneurs, revolutionary thought leaders, and rising stars of all kinds with the capacity, courage, and to CREATE A BETTER future.
profile_positions.title: FutureMaker

profile_positions.description: An industry expert on digital health, transformation, and sustainability in the corporate environment on a mission to make eyecare accessible for everyone through vision as a service.
profile_positions.title: Advisory Board Member

company.name: The European Society of Cataract and Refractive Surgeons (ESCRS)

profile_positions.company: The European Society of Cataract and Refractive Surgeons (ESCRS)
profile_positions.description:
The ESCRS are a society of surgeons who specialise in improving vision and restoring clarity. Since 1991, ESCRS has promoted education and research in the field of intraocular lens implantation and refractive surgery. With over 7,500 members from 130 countries, ESCRS is a vital global platform and one of the largest professional societies in the field of ophthalmology.

Through the Digital Health Committee, I contribute to shaping and guiding the digital agenda with the aim to bring to the front compartment of the eye some of the digital advances that are already being made for the retina. The ESCRS have an active group of researchers, clinicians and surgeons, and there is a lot of positive enthusiasm for digital transformation in the Society.

I'm a firm believer that the digitalization of healthcare will also bring about a net-positive impact on people and the planet. It delights me immensely to get to contribute towards these sustainable eHealth goals through this important digital focus at the ESCRS – especially where it concerns digital advances for the front compartment of the eye.
profile_positions.title: Digital Health Committee Transformation Leader

profile_positions.description: Non-Executive Supervisory Board Member at the Wortell Group, with a primary focus on Diversity, Inclusion, Equity, Marketing, and Internationalization.
profile_positions.title: Non-Executive Supervisory Board Member

profile_positions.description:
Serving as Chairwoman of the Non-Executive Advisory Board and as past-President of the Netherlands Chapter for Global Women in Tech®, an international organization with a double mission: to close the gender gap and empower 5 million girls and women to embrace a career or field of study in technology by 2030.

Creating and driving impact through a purpose-led performance-driven strategic mission and vision, developed and spearheaded key initiatives including Role Models Masterclasses, Entrepreneurial Pitching, (Low)Coding Programs, and Higher Level Educational Scholarships. Growing commercial and governmental partnerships and sponsorships with organizations, universities, platforms, and communities globally.

Women in Tech® fully supports the UN’s Sustainable development objectives by contributing to 5 of the 17 goals that will transform our World by 2030. Goal#5 is to achieve gender equality and empower women and girls, and the Tech field is one of its main targets.

Our organization is led by purpose and driven by action with a clear focus on the following key areas: Education & Digital Literacy, Business & Entrepreneurialism, Digital & Social Inclusion, Science, Technology & Innovation Partnerships. The aim is to educate, equip and empower women and girls with the necessary skills and confidence to succeed in STEM career fields.
profile_positions.title: Chairwoman, Non-Executive Advisory Board and past-President, The Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
Serving as Non-Executive Board Member and Chairwoman of the Jury Committee for the bi-annual Hennie Volker-Dieben Award at the Cornea Patients Association.

Ambassador for enabling persons with visual impairments through the lens of technology and digital eHealth solutions, and with a focus on community building and membership expansion. 

Developed HPV's purpose-led mission to drive impact by 2030 in alignment with 4 of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. Our focus, is on making a difference for persons with visual impairments, is in the areas of Good Health and Well Being, Decent Work and Economic Growth, Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure and Reduced Inequalities.

Keynote speaker at the Annual HPV Conference on themes including “Tips for Improving Communications with your Doctor” and "Enabling Persons with Visual Impairments through the Lens of Technology," and at the European Cornea and Cell Transplantation Registry (ECCTR) EU Conference.
profile_positions.title: Non-Executive Board Member and Chairwoman of the Jury Committee

profile_positions.description:
IG&H enables clients with digital end-to-end customer experience, management, and transformation capabilities, supporting them to simplify, differentiate, and grow in a constantly changing world. As Managing Director, I spearhead the growth of our international business and support global clients at the C-Suite to accelerate their digital and cultural transformation objectives, as we expand our trusted partnerships and footprint. My focus is on the Health and Retail sectors and in driving the holistic integration of our end-to-end digital and (low-code) technology capabilities, from strategy through to execution and support.

Led the strategic development of our Corporate Social Responsibility plan by bringing focus and measures to our purpose-led Sustainability ambitions. Introduced an Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) Framework and benchmarking platform, and aligned and streamlined our initiatives around 4 of the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to ensure that what we do matters and has a net positive impact. Executive sponsor for our Digital Marketing division and in guiding and modernising our Target Marketing Operating Model evolution.

I am a strong ally and advocate for Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Advocacy (IDEA) across the organisation. I introduced the Stratego Women's Leadership Development programme to mid-level female managers, personal branding and empowerment sessions organisation-wide, and social selling capabilities and partnerships to lift our collective online representation and presence.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director | Digital Transformation & Sustainability

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities: Revenue, market share and P&L performance of all Microsoft Business Groups for the Netherlands and the overall orchestration of Digital go-to-market sales, marketing, operations and services plans to achieve them. 

Cooperated with Western European teams in strategic development and sales attainment goals, through long-term cloud-first growth planning, the execution of core business processes – fiscal and marketing planning, revenue forecasting, blueprint, marketing budget management – market intelligence and insights, competitive analytics, Artificial Intelligence (AI), integrated marketing communications (employee comms and external PR), philanthropies, accessibility, and sustainability. The Netherlands is a multi-billion dollar country for Microsoft.
profile_positions.title: Chief Marketing & Chief Operations Officer

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities: Created the vision, strategic plan, and resourcing model, and spearheaded a step-change through Digital Transformation across an organisation of 1.800 people. Enabled cultural alignment & process improvements at all levels of the organisation from the CIO to the front-line worker, and positively transformed the delivery of IT business operations & practices and increased bottom-line value.

Achievements: Delivered $530M commercial savings and created new value and efficiencies for the Downstream businesses. Optimised and integrated key ops plans across horizontal touch-points and improved customer fulfilment processes including Offer to Cash (OTC), Aviation’s “Online Everywhere” strategic transformation for fueling and distribution at 400 airports, and Lubes offer to high net-worth customers. Facilitated Lean Practitioner and Manager training for 97% of the organisation and embedded the cultural mindset for sustainable business improvement. Increased cost efficiencies by 30%, strengthened the investment discipline in IT’s Strategic plans and leveraged the rapidly changing and disruptive business and technology environment into those plans. Maximised utilisation of skilled resources to deliver commercial results in the highest value areas of work, and advanced the maturity of IT’s operational excellence discipline.

Utilised digital business transformation expertise to develop the vision and strategic plan for an integrated Workplace Accessibility service, and led cross-functional teams to launch the capability globally. Raised awareness, lowered behavioural barriers, and improved processes to enable and increase productivity for nearly 20% (26.000) of individuals across Shell’s workforce. Vice-Chair for Shell’s enABLE Board, a network for persons with impairments, and launched 7 enABLE Networks globally. Senior Shell representative at the Business Disability Forum Technology Taskforce (UK) and Board Member of the Corneal Patients Association (NL).
profile_positions.title: VP, Continuous Improvement and Digitalization, Downstream Assets & Services Intl

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities: Directly managed 125 Technology employees (indirect influence 9.000+) across the Downstream Global Commercial (GC) domain in the Lubes Supply Chain, Commercial Fuels, and Liquids to Natural Gas (LNG) portfolios. Developed and led strategic and technological functional plans that integrated, improved, and transformed business value through aligned relationships focused on solving business issues, applying digital technology solutions, delivering better outcomes and upskilling employees. 

Achievements: Collaborated with asset teams across 64 prime locations at Lube Oil Blending Plants, Grease Plants, Commercial Fuels and LNG sites, and created solutions for the business to accelerate digital technology capability and innovation, improve asset integrity and management, decrease or avoid risk, strengthen credibility, and drive business results. Led the delivery of improved processes and sustainable services & solutions to manage goods, assets, and logistics in areas that improved customer satisfaction (index increased from 6.7 to 9.3), strengthened business value and grew revenue through Offer to Cash (OTC), Integrated Delivery, On Time In Full (OTIF), Asset Integrity & Management (AIM), and GSAP Change Requests in the GC Supply Chain and with Global Key partner accounts including Mercedes, BMW, and Scania.
profile_positions.title: General Manager, Digitalization - Downstream Assets & Services

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities: Spearheaded the business and digital transformation and step change that increased effective delivery of global Exploration & Production IT. Led 70 global staff (indirect influence 3.500+) and delivered innovative technology solutions at onshore / offshore platforms and facilities and expanded business value in the Upstream Exploration & Production Operations business. 

Achievements: Delivered global projects and drove $430M worth of efficiencies to achieve “more upstream” and improved cost performance through a focus on the business's key objectives and benchmarking measures. Optimised and delivered an improved and integrated Wells, Reservoirs, and Facilities Management (WRFM) process and brought innovative technology solutions to accelerate capability and differentiation to the Upstream businesses. Developed and executed the strategic plan that enabled the remote operation of offshore assets through the launch of Shell's first Remote Operating Control Centre (ROCC) in the Gulf of Mexico, the European Basin, and the East.

Drove functional excellence through top quartile support rationalisation and was recognised for leadership on key topics related to Health, Safety, and the Environment. Accredited and certified across Health & Safety, Risk, and Audit disciplines through Helicopter Underwater Evacuation Training (HUET), Operational Safety for Supervisors, first aid and emergency response (Falck-Nutec), and led safety walks and incident investigation and reporting for significant risks, conducted audit case reviews and response, and embedded asset risk management policies.

Applied innovative technology and digital thinking to streamline Asset Integrity and Management (AIM) processes to increase speed and quality, decrease risk, and focus on ruthless prioritisation of key portfolio investments. Created the strategic plan and resourcing model to deliver improved cost efficiencies, enhance stakeholder trust, and strengthen business integration.
profile_positions.title: General Manager, Global Upstream Production Performance Improvement & Digital Transformation

volunteer_experiences.role: Digital Literacy Country Chair, The Netherlands
volunteer_experiences.description: On a mission to provide thought leadership, inclusion & action on upskilling girls and women in Digital Literacy and enabling the economic & social empowerment of women in The Netherlands and around the world, to address gender gaps & achieve parity with a global, cross-cultural, intentional perspective toward peace, parity & prosperity for all. 100 women, 100 sectors, 100 allies.

Creating and driving impact through a purpose-led performance-driven strategic mission and vision, developed and spearheaded key initiatives including Role Models Masterclasses, Entrepreneurial Pitching, (Low)Coding Programs, and Higher Level Educational Scholarships. volunteer_experiences.role: Non-Executive Board Member and Chairwoman of the Jury Committee
volunteer_experiences.description:
Serving as Non-Executive Board Member and Chairwoman of the Jury Committee for the bi-annual Hennie Volker-Dieben Award at the Cornea Patients Association.

Ambassador for enabling persons with visual impairments through the lens of technology and digital eHealth solutions, and with a focus on community building and membership expansion. 

Developed HPV's purpose-led mission to drive impact by 2030 in alignment with 4 of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. Our focus, is on making a difference for persons with visual impairments, is in the areas of Good Health and Well Being, Decent Work and Economic Growth, Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure and Reduced Inequalities.

Keynote speaker at the Annual HPV Conference on themes including “Tips for Improving Communications with your Doctor” and "Enabling Persons with Visual Impairments through the Lens of Technology," and at the European Cornea and Cell Transplantation Registry (ECCTR) EU Conference.

Serving on the ThinkTank Advisory Committee of the Global Shell Alumni Network to lead the development of the Alumni Member Value Proposition and Services and launch a new global membership network for anyone who used to work at Shell and is still active in work and/or community. 

The purpose of the Shell Alumni Network is to create a community and be connected with each other, to continue to learn, grow and develop, and to create new opportunities for ourselves and others, for commercial and non-commercial purposes and personal and business opportunities, whilst doing good for our society and the planet.

Serving on the Quality Council to "fast-forward the impact of emerging tech". In my role, my focus is to ensure that the Academy empowers diverse individuals to choose for a course of study or career in the field of tech and that they incorporate and enable the key principles and standards of ethics and inclusion in all they do.

Volunteering as a Mentor to connect with individuals in the IT/Tech sector who are exploring their transition from Study to Career to offer them the best possible insights into career options and opportunities.

volunteer_experiences.role: Senior Shell representative at the Technology Taskforce
volunteer_experiences.description: Global collaboration of 45 corporations who share the common vision to improve the workplace through technology services and solutions for persons with impairments. Subject matter expert for persons with visual impairments; work-stream lead to develop vendor engagement model.
